title: Sertraline (Zoloft)
description: SSRI antidepressant commonly prescribed for generalized anxiety disorder and panic disorder. Helps regulate serotonin levels in the brain.
effectiveness_rationale: Multiple RCTs show 60-70% response rate for anxiety symptoms. First-line treatment with extensive safety data spanning decades. FDA-approved for multiple anxiety disorders.

title: Headspace App
description: Popular meditation and mindfulness app with guided sessions specifically designed for anxiety, stress, and sleep issues.
effectiveness_rationale: Clinical study with 8,000+ participants showed significant reduction in stress after 30 days. RCT published in 2018 found 14-28% reduction in anxiety symptoms. 4.5 star average from 500k+ reviews.

title: Lexapro (Escitalopram)
description: SSRI antidepressant widely prescribed for generalized anxiety disorder and depression. Known for faster onset compared to other SSRIs.
effectiveness_rationale: Meta-analysis shows 65-75% response rate for GAD. FDA-approved first-line treatment. Studies show symptom improvement typically within 2-4 weeks, faster than many alternatives.

title: CBT with licensed therapist
description: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy focused on identifying and changing thought patterns that contribute to anxiety. In-person or telehealth sessions.
effectiveness_rationale: Gold standard psychological treatment for anxiety. Meta-analysis of 100+ studies shows 50-75% of patients achieve significant symptom reduction. Effects maintained long-term in follow-up studies.

title: Propranolol
description: Beta-blocker medication that reduces physical symptoms of anxiety like rapid heartbeat, trembling, and sweating. Often used for performance anxiety.
effectiveness_rationale: Multiple studies show 60-70% reduction in physical anxiety symptoms. Particularly effective for situational anxiety and public speaking. Works within 30-60 minutes.

title: Vinyasa yoga
description: Dynamic flowing yoga style that links breath with movement. Combines physical exercise with mindfulness to reduce stress and anxiety.
effectiveness_rationale: Systematic review of 12 RCTs found yoga significantly reduces anxiety symptoms (effect size 0.41). Practice 2-3 times weekly shows sustained benefits. Combines physical activity with mindfulness components.

title: Morning Pages journaling
description: Daily practice of writing 3 pages of stream-of-consciousness thoughts first thing in the morning. Helps process worries and clear mental clutter.
effectiveness_rationale: Study published in JAMA Psychiatry found expressive writing reduced anxiety symptoms by 25-30%. Regular journaling associated with decreased rumination and improved emotional regulation.

title: Magnesium glycinate supplement
description: Highly absorbable form of magnesium that supports nervous system function and helps regulate stress response. Often deficient in people with anxiety.
effectiveness_rationale: Systematic review found magnesium supplementation reduces mild-to-moderate anxiety in 50-60% of participants. Glycinate form has highest bioavailability and least digestive side effects.

title: Dare app
description: CBT-based anxiety app focused on acceptance techniques and responding differently to panic attacks and anxious thoughts.
effectiveness_rationale: Based on evidence-based acceptance and commitment therapy principles. User surveys show 65% report reduced anxiety within 4 weeks. 4.7 star rating from 20k+ reviews. Clinical psychologist-developed.

title: Progressive muscle relaxation
description: Systematic technique of tensing and relaxing muscle groups throughout the body to reduce physical tension and activate the relaxation response.
effectiveness_rationale: Meta-analysis of 27 studies found significant anxiety reduction (effect size 0.57). Particularly effective for reducing physical symptoms of anxiety. Easy to learn and practice independently.
